section.title: Service for capturing trace into file
General
section.para: capture_trace - service-like tool for capture output of payloads' tracepoints into file, specified by user.

listitem.para: Path to file, where to store results of capturing.

Directory, where debugfs filesystem is currently mounted. This filesystem contains tracing file, which will be capturing. When argument is not supplied, it is assumed that mount point of debugfs filesystem is /sys/kernel/debug.

section.title: capture_trace start
section.para: capture_trace start start to capturing output into tracing file and store this output into file file. Note, that all strings, stored in file, are deleted from tracing file.
If capturing already started, capture_trace start does nothing and returns 1.

section.title: capture_trace stop
section.para: capture_trace stop stops to capturing tracing file. After this command is returned, all tracing strings are stored into tracing file as usual.
If capturing is not started, capture_trace stop does nothing and returns 1.

section.title: &kedr-service; status
section.para: capture_trace status report, whether capturing was started or not. In the future, it may also report, into what file trace is stored.
